intro: Mappa fastuosa, commonly known as the showy mappa, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of bright red or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
